name: Pious Doom in a Tunic: Monk 9/Assassin 13/Wizard 8
author: HipMaestro

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
This concept was developed to compensate for the ungodly slow game play of most stealth assassins. Stealthing has always seemed like playing the game underwater to me, so I just don't make stealth builds because of that. But this one gains enough monk speed to make it tolerable, to me anyway. Also, I decided to stray from the typical dex stealther build to see if a strength-based design would deliver enough damage along with a decent Death Attack to control most mobs and survive without high AC. It seems to work well (so far ).

Essentially, my strategy has been to buff up while stealthing, cast Darkness and choose the most offensive target in the cloud. If a DA is triggered I move to the next target. As DA's are triggered I keep moving to remaining targets until they are all paralyzed and then mop up. I have over an hour to do the mopping so have been able to handle rather large mobs without taking many hits. My character has not gotten KD'd or Disarmed... Yet! As long as there aren't True Seers about there is little chance to get my shrouded attack from being interrupted even if the DA doesn't trigger. True Seers will chase me out of the cloud and become separated from the other enemies and can destroyed, hopefully, before the darkness wears off if there are only a few.

I save the True Strikes for boss killing or uber high AC creatures since the buffed AB seems high enough to hit most ordinary foes often.

I would love to hear how it fares in the environment you play if you decide to give it a whirl. If there are Int-boosting items there, this build should really shine. Collect scrolls of mantles, if available.

Full dissection is happily welcome!

Notes

1. Ability spread variants: As an option, CON can be dropped to 14 to raise DEX and WIS to 10 to avoid the negatives and gain better AC and saves buffing at the cost of 30 HPs. Allow the specific environment dictate which makes the most sense. INT is set at 16 for the boost to DA and for the extra slots which are scarce. The INT is feasible to lower to the minimum 14 to cast all spells but is an inconvenience for slot management.

2. Kama focus is recommended to gain the monk attack progression. Unarmed is another viable choice but will lack the buffs from Keen Edge, Flame Weapon & GMW. Dual kamas, although subject to DW penalty is still workable to reach the seventh APR. Handaxe (crit x3) is also good focus but will lose the monk progression.

3. It was felt that enemy KD/IKD & Disarm were the most significant threats during combat, so the Discipline skill was enhanced as much as practical. Should the environment contain few encounters with foes spamming KD/Disarm, this is a good spot to sub another feat.
